channel.title: Tech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Tech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Coalition demands federal Grok ban over nonconsensual sexual content
item.description: Nonprofits urge the U.S. government to suspend Grok in federal agencies after the xAI chatbot generated thousands of nonconsensual sexual images, rais...

item.title: Elon Musk’s SpaceX officially acquires Elon Musk’s xAI, with plan to build data centers in space
item.description: The merger creates the world's most valuable private company, and paves the way for Musk to try and prove out the usefulness of space-based data cente...

item.title: UpScrolled’s founder says the social network has zoomed past 2.5M users
item.description: Upscrolled founder said that the social network was launched six years ago and had 150,000 users until January

item.title: Ring brings its ‘Search Party’ feature for finding lost dogs to non-Ring camera owners
item.description: Ring's Search Party feature for finding lost dogs is now available across the U.S. — even if you don't own a Ring camera.

item.title: Linq raises $20M to enable AI assistants to live within messaging apps
item.description: Linq offers an API that lets companies offer their AI assistants via iMessage, RCS and SMS.

item.title: What Snowflake’s deal with OpenAI tells us about the enterprise AI race
item.description: Snowflake is the latest enterprise to sign multi-year deals with multiple AI companies in what could be a sign to come of a future trend.

item.title: China is leading the fight against hidden car door handles
item.description: The Chinese government issued a new rule that goes into effect January 1, 2027.

item.title: Carbon Robotics built an AI model that detects and identifies plants
item.description: Carbon Robotics' Large Plant Model will allow farmers to kill new types of weeds without having to retrain the machines.

item.title: Two Stanford students launch $2M startup accelerator for students nationwide
item.description: "Breakthrough’s purpose is to fill in the funding and opportunity gap that exists in many of these ecosystems because students have historically lacke...

item.title: Adobe Animate is shutting down as company focuses on AI
item.description: Adobe Animate will be discontinued on March 1, 2026, as Adobe shifts its focus to AI.
